title: How to Fix Analog Sticks on Dual Shock 2 Controller for PS2

steps.headline: While the game is active, push in both sticks (thus pressing R3 and L3)
While sticks are pressed down, wiggle both sticks in a circular motion for about 5 seconds.
Your game should resume as normal.
steps.description: If the character was moving when you were not touching the controller,    this should fix the problem. Just repeat steps 1&2 while on title screen (press start).

steps.headline: Check it in your PS2 manual!
steps.description: Every time you start PS2, move analog in a circular motion 1 time, and then your stick will not move itself.

text: While the game is active, push in both sticks (thus pressing R3 and L3)  While sticks are pressed down, wiggle both sticks in a circular motion for about 5 seconds.  Your game should resume as normal. If the character was moving when you were not touching the controller,    this should fix the problem. Just repeat steps 1&2 while on title screen (press start). Check it in your PS2 manual! Every time you start PS2, move analog in a circular motion 1 time, and then your stick will not move itself.
sentences: While the game is active, push in both sticks (thus pressing R3 and L3)  While sticks are pressed down, wiggle both sticks in a circular motion for about 5 seconds.
Your game should resume as normal.
If the character was moving when you were not touching the controller,    this should fix the problem.
Just repeat steps 1&2 while on title screen (press start).
Check it in your PS2 manual!
Every time you start PS2, move analog in a circular motion 1 time, and then your stick will not move itself.
